product_name: Carpet Tile With Glasbac Backing And Nylon 6 Yarn
product_code: Refer to Interface's website for specific product information
product_description: Interface offers modular carpet tiles that blend design, function, and ease of installation.
recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.

Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.

end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list

minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.

reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
substances_of_concern_description: Interface uses Best environmental Practice PVC in product backing. PVC is not listed in either ECHA or REACH harmful chemical registers. BEP PVC is not referenced in the red list. PVC is listed in the red list
factory_finished_description: Made with sustainably sourced materials and manufactured wholly in Australia.
specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.

specific_installation_methods: Interface flooring can be installed in two ways, using a low VOC, water-based pressure sensitive adhesive or adhesive free using our trade marked TacTiles™ method. Both methods of installation allow easy removal of the carpet tile at end-of-use and recovery though the ReEntry program. Note composting is not an option.
type_of_packaging: Product is packaged in 100% recycled content cardboard boxes and shipped on non-chemically treated wooden pallets manufactured specifically for Interface.

recyclable_percentage_description: Interface accepts full responsibility for its products throughout their life cycle and will take back all product at end-of-use for return to its facility in Minto, NSW. The product is inspected and designated for reuse or sent offshore to Interface USA for remanufacturing. Note there are no recycling options for carpet tile in Australia.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Off-cuts are recyclable through our re-manufacturing processes. Recovery instructions specify that they are kept separate from the full carpet tile when packaged for return to the Minto facility.
recycling_process_description: Interface carpet tiles consist of layers which can be mechanically separated into materials that can be re-used in manufacturing of new carpet products or recycled as raw materials for other products. In 2023, 60% of post-consumer carpet taken back was recycled through Interface processes, 21% was re-used and 20% was sent for waste to energy recovery. See Interface 2023 Impact Report
reusable_description: Interface carpet tile is easily uplifted for reuse or remanufacturing at our USA facility. See below for product installation options.
end_of_life_program_description: Interface operates its product take back program called ReEntry. All products are warrantied for long life and designed with circularity in mind. See attached documents that illustrate how we manage the take back of our carpet products at end of first life and the options we use to a) extend the life of the product through our reuse program or b) send to our remanufacturing process to convert into new products.
water_reduction_techniques: No. Interface uses very low quantities of water in its manufacturing facilities. The bulk of water use is for employee amenities.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: We measure to manage. Transport emissions account for less than 3% of product carbon impact. Interface uses a freight services company that is fully transparent with respect to its vehicle carbon emissions.  Online access to the transport company's emissions dashboard enables Interface to optimise loading and route selection to minimise transport associated carbon impacts. In addition low emissions transport  i.e. rail is chosen where possible.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choosing modular flooring is the first step to designing out installation waste. The Interface Design Studio based in Sydney is fully equipped to design the entire floorplan, develop a bill of materials and allow selection of designs that will minimise waste.
modern_slavery_comments:
In 2019, Interface Australia formed a regional working group with our European procurement teams to better understand risk exposure and to develop improved synergy across our business in tackling threats of modern slavery across our shared supply chains. 
Our current methodology for focusing attention is based on spend. Priority been given to spend in the highest risk countries and sectors. Engagement with third party consultants and platforms has assisted in improving supply chain mapping, filling knowledge gaps, and refocusing resources to the areas of highest risk
